alert.note: Alert for Camden (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 2:50PM EDT until August 10 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern New Jersey...including the following counties...Burlington and Camden. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 249 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Rainfall totals up to 1.0 to 1.5 inches are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Evesham, Voorhees, Medford, Lindenwold, Lumberton, Berlin, Tabernacle, Shamong, Presidential Lakes Estates, Chesilhurst, Pemberton, and Wrightstown. - This includes the following highways... Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 34 and 37. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
